trans-unit.source: This section documents the JDBC interfaces that <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> implements for Java EE compliance.

seg-source.mrk: This section documents the JDBC interfaces that <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> implements for Java EE compliance.

target.mrk: This section documents the JDBC interfaces that <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> implements for Java EE compliance.

trans-unit.source: For more details about these interfaces, see the API documentation for your version of the Java Development Kit, which you can find at <xref format="html" href="http://download.oracle.com/javase/" scope="external">http://download.oracle.com/javase/</xref>.

seg-source.mrk: For more details about these interfaces, see the API documentation for your version of the Java Development Kit, which you can find at <xref format="html" href="http://download.oracle.com/javase/" scope="external">http://download.oracle.com/javase/</xref>.

target.mrk: For more details about these interfaces, see the API documentation for your version of the Java Development Kit, which you can find at <xref format="html" href="http://download.oracle.com/javase/" scope="external">http://download.oracle.com/javase/</xref>.

trans-unit.source: An interface that is a factory for connections to the physical data source that the object represents. An object that implements the DataSource interface will typically be registered with a naming service based on the Java Naming and Directory (JNDI) API. The <codeph>org.apache.derby.jdbc</codeph> DataSource classes support the JNDI API, with the exception of the DataSource classes that support Java SE 8 Compact Profiles 2 and 3. See <xref href="rrefjdbc4_0dataSource.dita#rrefjdbc4_0dataSource"></xref>, <xref href="rrefjdbc4_1datasource.dita#rrefjdbc4_1datasource"></xref>, and <xref href="rrefjdbc4_2compactprofiles.dita#rrefjdbc4_2compactprofiles"></xref> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: An interface that is a factory for connections to the physical data source that the object represents.
An object that implements the DataSource interface will typically be registered with a naming service based on the Java Naming and Directory (JNDI) API.
The <codeph>org.apache.derby.jdbc</codeph> DataSource classes support the JNDI API, with the exception of the DataSource classes that support Java SE 8 Compact Profiles 2 and 3.

target.mrk: An interface that is a factory for connections to the physical data source that the object represents.
An object that implements the DataSource interface will typically be registered with a naming service based on the Java Naming and Directory (JNDI) API.
The <codeph>org.apache.derby.jdbc</codeph> DataSource classes support the JNDI API, with the exception of the DataSource classes that support Java SE 8 Compact Profiles 2 and 3.

trans-unit.source: Establishing a connection to the database can be a relatively expensive operation in client/server environments. Establishing the connection once and then using the same connection for multiple requests can dramatically improve the performance of a database.

seg-source.mrk: Establishing a connection to the database can be a relatively expensive operation in client/server environments.
Establishing the connection once and then using the same connection for multiple requests can dramatically improve the performance of a database.

target.mrk: Establishing a connection to the database can be a relatively expensive operation in client/server environments.
Establishing the connection once and then using the same connection for multiple requests can dramatically improve the performance of a database.

trans-unit.source: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> implementation of <codeph>ConnectionPoolDataSource</codeph> and <codeph>PooledConnection</codeph > interfaces allows a connection pool server to maintain a set of such connections to the resource manager (<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>). In an embedded environment, connections are much cheaper and connection pooling is not necessary.

seg-source.mrk: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> implementation of <codeph>ConnectionPoolDataSource</codeph> and <codeph>PooledConnection</codeph > interfaces allows a connection pool server to maintain a set of such connections to the resource manager (<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>).
In an embedded environment, connections are much cheaper and connection pooling is not necessary.

target.mrk: The <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> implementation of <codeph>ConnectionPoolDataSource</codeph> and <codeph>PooledConnection</codeph > interfaces allows a connection pool server to maintain a set of such connections to the resource manager (<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>).
In an embedded environment, connections are much cheaper and connection pooling is not necessary.

trans-unit.source: An XAConnection produces an XAResource, and, over its lifetime, many Connections. This type of connection allows for distributed transactions.

seg-source.mrk: An XAConnection produces an XAResource, and, over its lifetime, many Connections.
This type of connection allows for distributed transactions.

target.mrk: An XAConnection produces an XAResource, and, over its lifetime, many Connections.
This type of connection allows for distributed transactions.

trans-unit.source: An XADataSource is simply a ConnectionPoolDataSource that produces XAConnections.

seg-source.mrk: An XADataSource is simply a ConnectionPoolDataSource that produces XAConnections.

target.mrk: An XADataSource is simply a ConnectionPoolDataSource that produces XAConnections.

trans-unit.source: In addition, provides three methods for XADataSource, DataSource, and ConnectionPoolDataSource. supports a number of additional data source properties:

seg-source.mrk: In addition, provides three methods for XADataSource, DataSource, and ConnectionPoolDataSource.
<ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> supports a number of additional data source properties:

target.mrk: In addition, provides three methods for XADataSource, DataSource, and ConnectionPoolDataSource.

trans-unit.source: Sets a property to create a database at the next connection. The string argument must be "create".

seg-source.mrk: Sets a property to create a database at the next connection.

target.mrk: Sets a property to create a database at the next connection.

trans-unit.source: Sets a property to shut down a database. Shuts down the database at the next connection. The string argument must be "shutdown".

seg-source.mrk: Sets a property to shut down a database.
Shuts down the database at the next connection.

target.mrk: Sets a property to shut down a database.
